episode_summary: This episode covers right-ear dominance in persuasion, the raven-derived origins and curious history of Ramsgate, a Nobel Prize winner who missed the call while off-grid and a dive into off-grid living, and Morrisseyâ€™s meat-free gig policies leading to security pat-downs. Along the way the gang riff on hearing differences, wartime tunnels, celebrity riders, and infamous bad sex writing.

facts.fact: Well you're more likely to get your way if you ask one for a favor in the right ear and not the left ear it's called right ear dominance
my fat this week is that the town of Ramsgate is named after a gate for Ravens
my fact is the scientist who won this year's Nobel prize for medicine didn't find out for nearly a day because he'd gone off grid and he only found out after his wife got two hundred texts
my fact this week is that at Morrissey gigs security have been known to pat down fans to search them for meat
